problem_text:
Let X be a finite set and f a mapping from the set of subsets of X to the positive integers. Under the requirement that in a group generated by X, every subgroup ⟨Y ⟩, Y ⊆ X, be nilpotent of class ⩽ f(Y ), is it true that the free group Gf relative to this condition is torsion-free?
A. Yu. Olshanskii
answer: Not always (V. V. Bludov, V. F. Kleimenov, E. V. Khlamov, Algebra and Logic, 29 (1990), 95–96).
